title: Locksmith
data:
The **Locksmith** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") in the variant [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

It can be played as a neutral human, elf, gnome, hobbit, or clockwork automaton.

The Locksmith first appeared in an early version of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") ([NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10")) but was dropped from the code at the time the [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branch was ported into that variant. The role was later revived and given a quest in SlashTHEM.

In SlashTHEM the Locksmith gets a bonus to [picking locks](/wiki/Unlocking_tool "Unlocking tool"), similar to the [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue") role.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Skills](#Skills)
- [2 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [3 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)
- [4 Rank titles](#Rank_titles)
- [5 Quest](#Quest)
- [6 Gods](#Gods)
- [7 History](#History)
- [8 References](#References)

## Skills

NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), which predated the [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") system, so Locksmiths could use any weapons.

SLASHTHEM gives the Locksmith a skill set closer to the [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue")'s:

| Locksmith skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| ---------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max              | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Basic            | - *Weapons:* [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword"), [morning star](/wiki/Morning_star "Morning star"), [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail"), [hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear")
- *Combat:* [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding")                                                                                                                                                          |
| Skilled          | * *Weapons:* [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword"), [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [paddle](/wiki/Paddle "Paddle"), [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")
* *Spells:* [divination](/wiki/Divination_spells "Divination spells"), [body](/wiki/Body_spells "Body spells"), [matter](/wiki/Matter_spells "Matter spells") |
| Expert           | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [firearm](/wiki/Firearm "Firearm"), [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")
- *Combat:* [two weapon combat](/wiki/Two_weapon_combat "Two weapon combat"), [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")                                                                                                             |

The Locksmith's [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell"), fittingly enough, is [knock](/wiki/Knock "Knock"). Spell success is determined by [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence").

- SlashTHEM u\_init.c line 2055 in v. 0.8

## Intrinsics

- XL 1: [Searching](/wiki/Searching "Searching")

## Starting equipment

- [Wand of opening](/wiki/Wand_of_opening "Wand of opening")
- [Wand of locking](/wiki/Wand_of_locking "Wand of locking")
- A [skeleton key](/wiki/Skeleton_key "Skeleton key")
- A [lock pick](/wiki/Lock_pick "Lock pick")
- A [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack")
- 5 +0 [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") (SlashTHEM)

## Rank titles

SLASHTHEM has a slightly different set of rank titles:

- XL 1-2: Listener
- XL 3-5: Lockpicker
- XL 6-9: Lock Breaker
- XL 10-13: Lock Trickster
- XL 14-17: Safecracker
- XL 18-21: Keymaster
- XL 22-25: Slim Jim/Slim Jane
- XL 26-29: Keymaker
- XL 30: Supreme Locksmith

SlashTHEM role.c line 860

## Quest

| @ Burglar Ed [File:Burglar Ed.png](/index.php?title=Special:Upload\&wpDestFile=Burglar_Ed.png "File:Burglar Ed.png") |                                 |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| **Attacks**                                                                                                          | Weapon 4d6, Kick 6d4 steal item |
|                                                                                                                      |                                 |

| @ Burglar Ed [File:Burglar Ed.png](/index.php?title=Special:Upload\&wpDestFile=Burglar_Ed.png "File:Burglar Ed.png")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |                                                                      |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Attacks**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | Weapon 4d6, Kick 6d4 steal item                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                      |
| **Base [level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | 15                                                                   |
| **[Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | 13                                                                   |
| **Base [AC](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | -4                                                                   |
| **[Base MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | 0                                                                    |
| **[Alignment](/wiki/Alignment#Monster_alignment "Alignment")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | -15 (chaotic)                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                      |
| **[Frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency")** (by [normal means](/wiki/Normal_mechanism "Normal mechanism"))                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | unique                                                               |
| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | no                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                      |
| **[Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | 1450                                                                 |
| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | 400                                                                  |
| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | medium                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                      |
| **[Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | stoning                                                              |
| **Resistances [conveyed](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | none                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                      |
| Burglar Ed:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is male.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food. |                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | [monst.c, line 6882](/wiki/Source:Monst.c#line6882 "Source:Monst.c") |

The [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") sees the Locksmith fighting [Burglar Ed](/index.php?title=Burglar_Ed\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Burglar Ed (page does not exist)") for the [Lockpick of Arsene Lupin](/index.php?title=Lockpick_of_Arsene_Lupin\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Lockpick of Arsene Lupin (page does not exist)"), a neutral [lockpick](/wiki/Lockpick "Lockpick"). When carried, it grants [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"), [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth"), [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning"), and [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), and functions as a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone"). When used, it gives a random [rumor](/wiki/Rumor "Rumor"), and it can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") to [untrap](/wiki/Untrap "Untrap") a door or container with 100% success. The maps are copies from the [Rogue quest](/wiki/Rogue_quest "Rogue quest"), but with [muggers](/wiki/Mugger "Mugger") and [street thugs](/index.php?title=Street_thug\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Street thug (page does not exist)").

- SlashTHEM artilist.h line 824

## Gods

The Locksmith's gods are taken from Celtic mythology:

- Lawful: Nuada
- Neutral: Dagda
- Chaotic: Morrigan

## History

The Locksmith's first appearance was in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") precursor [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"), as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in [the contemporary version of NetHack](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"). The discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet. See [here](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/rec.games.hack/jg8YtQX1M3Y/tbBlteXdYY8J) for the relevant post.

After the release of [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3") in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to [NetHack-- 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack--_3.1.3 "NetHack-- 3.1.3") by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version. Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack. Most significantly, NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branch. To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.

The Locksmith role, along with the other eight new roles in NetHack-- 3.0.10, made its reappearance in the variant SlashTHEM.

## References

- NetHack-- 3.0.10 attrib.c line 74
- NetHack-- 3.0.10 u\_init.c line 230
html:
Locksmith

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Locksmith is a role in the variant SlashTHEM.

It can be played as a neutral human, elf, gnome, hobbit, or clockwork automaton.

The Locksmith first appeared in an early version of SLASH'EM (NetHack-- 3.0.10) but was dropped from the code at the time the quest branch was ported into that variant. The role was later revived and given a quest in SlashTHEM.

In SlashTHEM the Locksmith gets a bonus to picking locks, similar to the Rogue role.

Contents

  • 1 Skills
  • 2 Intrinsics
  • 3 Starting equipment
  • 4 Rank titles
  • 5 Quest
  • 6 Gods
  • 7 History
  • 8 References

Skills

NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on NetHack 3.0.10, which predated the skill system, so Locksmiths could use any weapons.

SLASHTHEM gives the Locksmith a skill set closer to the Rogue's:

Locksmith skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: two-handed sword, morning star, flail, hammer, polearms, spear
  • Combat: riding
Skilled
  • Weapons: broadsword, long sword, scimitar, saber, club, paddle, mace, shuriken
  • Spells: divination, body, matter
Expert
  • Weapons: dagger, knife, short sword, firearm, crossbow, dart
  • Combat: two weapon combat, bare hands

The Locksmith's special spell, fittingly enough, is knock. Spell success is determined by intelligence.

  • SlashTHEM u_init.c line 2055 in v. 0.8

Intrinsics

  • XL 1: Searching

Starting equipment

  • Wand of opening
  • Wand of locking
  • A skeleton key
  • A lock pick
  • A sack
  • 5 +0 daggers (SlashTHEM)

Rank titles

SLASHTHEM has a slightly different set of rank titles:

  • XL 1-2: Listener
  • XL 3-5: Lockpicker
  • XL 6-9: Lock Breaker
  • XL 10-13: Lock Trickster
  • XL 14-17: Safecracker
  • XL 18-21: Keymaster
  • XL 22-25: Slim Jim/Slim Jane
  • XL 26-29: Keymaker
  • XL 30: Supreme Locksmith

SlashTHEM role.c line 860

Quest

@ Burglar Ed File:Burglar Ed.png
Attacks Weapon 4d6, Kick 6d4 steal item
@ Burglar Ed File:Burglar Ed.png
Attacks

Weapon 4d6, Kick 6d4 steal item

Base level 15

Speed 13
Base AC -4
Base MR 0
Alignment -15 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) unique
Genocidable no
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium
Resistances stoning
Resistances conveyed none

Burglar Ed:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
Reference monst.c, line 6882

The quest sees the Locksmith fighting Burglar Ed for the Lockpick of Arsene Lupin, a neutral lockpick. When carried, it grants telepathy, stealth, warning, and magic resistance, and functions as a luckstone. When used, it gives a random rumor, and it can be invoked to untrap a door or container with 100% success. The maps are copies from the Rogue quest, but with muggers and street thugs.

  • SlashTHEM artilist.h line 824

Gods

The Locksmith's gods are taken from Celtic mythology:

  • Lawful: Nuada
  • Neutral: Dagda
  • Chaotic: Morrigan

History

The Locksmith's first appearance was in SLASH'EM precursor NetHack-- 3.0.10, as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in the contemporary version of NetHack. The discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet. See here for the relevant post.

After the release of NetHack 3.1.3 in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to NetHack-- 3.1.3 by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version. Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack. Most significantly, NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the Quest branch. To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.

The Locksmith role, along with the other eight new roles in NetHack-- 3.0.10, made its reappearance in the variant SlashTHEM.

References

  • NetHack-- 3.0.10 attrib.c line 74
  • NetHack-- 3.0.10 u_init.c line 230

rawPage:
The '''Locksmith''' is a [[role]] in the variant [[SlashTHEM]].  

It can be played as a neutral human, elf, gnome, hobbit, or clockwork automaton.

The Locksmith first appeared in an early version of [[SLASH'EM]] ([[NetHack-- 3.0.10]]) but was dropped from the code at the time the [[quest]] branch was ported into that variant.  The role was later revived and given a quest in SlashTHEM.

In SlashTHEM the Locksmith gets a bonus to [[Unlocking tool|picking locks]], similar to the [[Rogue]] role.

==Skills==
NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on [[NetHack 3.0.10]], which predated the [[skill]] system, so Locksmiths could use any weapons. 

SLASHTHEM gives the Locksmith a skill set closer to the [[Rogue]]'s:

{| class="prettytable"
! colspan="2" style="font-size:larger" | Locksmith skills
|-
! Max !! Skills
|-
| Basic
|
* ''Weapons:'' [[two-handed sword]], [[morning star]], [[flail]], [[hammer]], [[polearms]], [[spear]]
* ''Combat:'' [[riding]]
|-
| Skilled
|
* ''Weapons:'' [[broadsword]], [[long sword]], [[scimitar]], [[saber]], [[club]], [[paddle]], [[mace]], [[shuriken]]
* ''Spells:'' [[divination spells|divination]], [[body spells|body]], [[matter spells|matter]]
|-
| Expert
|
* ''Weapons:'' [[dagger]], [[knife]], [[short sword]], [[firearm]], [[crossbow]], [[dart]]
* ''Combat:'' [[two weapon combat]], [[bare hands]]
|}

The Locksmith's [[special spell]], fittingly enough, is [[knock]].  Spell success is determined by [[intelligence]].

*SlashTHEM u_init.c line 2055 in v. 0.8

==Intrinsics==
* XL 1: [[Searching]]

==Starting equipment==
* [[Wand of opening]]
* [[Wand of locking]]
* A [[skeleton key]]
* A [[lock pick]]
* A [[sack]]
* 5 +0 [[dagger]]s (SlashTHEM)

==Rank titles==
SLASHTHEM has a slightly different set of rank titles:

* XL 1-2: Listener
* XL 3-5: Lockpicker
* XL 6-9: Lock Breaker
* XL 10-13: Lock Trickster
* XL 14-17: Safecracker
* XL 18-21: Keymaster
* XL 22-25: Slim Jim/Slim Jane
* XL 26-29: Keymaker
* XL 30: Supreme Locksmith

The [[quest]] sees the Locksmith fighting [[Burglar Ed]] for the [[Lockpick of Arsene Lupin]], a neutral [[lockpick]]. When carried, it grants [[telepathy]], [[stealth]], [[warning]], and [[magic resistance]], and functions as a [[luckstone]]. When used, it gives a random [[rumor]], and it can be [[invoke]]d to [[untrap]] a door or container with 100% success.
The maps are copies from the [[Rogue quest]], but with [[mugger]]s and [[street thug]]s.

*SlashTHEM artilist.h line 824

==Gods==
The Locksmith's gods are taken from Celtic mythology:

* Lawful: Nuada
* Neutral: Dagda
* Chaotic: Morrigan

==History==
The Locksmith's first appearance was in [[SLASH'EM]] precursor [[NetHack-- 3.0.10]], as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in [[NetHack 3.0.10|the contemporary version of NetHack]].  The discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet. See [https://groups.google.com/d/msg/rec.games.hack/jg8YtQX1M3Y/tbBlteXdYY8J here] for the relevant 
post.

After the release of [[NetHack 3.1.3]] in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to [[NetHack-- 3.1.3]] by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version.  Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack.  Most significantly, NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the [[Quest]] branch.  To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.

The Locksmith role, along with the other eight new roles in NetHack-- 3.0.10, made its reappearance in the variant SlashTHEM.
